byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Cairo, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Fort Erie, Ontario. Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

abstract: Egyptian military uses F-16 war planes and helicopters to counter coordinated assault in Northern Sinai by group affiliated with Islamic State; scale and complexity of assault may be signal that group is working more closely with ISIS leadership in Syria; following assassination of country's top prosecutor, attack underscores inability of Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi's government to restore order in country after two years in power.
lead_paragraph: Two years after President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi led a military takeover promising to restore order and security in Egypt, he faces a rising jihadist insurgency.

headline.main: Jihadist Attacks on Egypt Grow Fiercer
headline.print_headline: Jihadist Attacks on Egyptians Grow Fiercer

snippet: Two years after President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi led a military takeover promising to restore order and security in Egypt, he faces a rising jihadist insurgency.
